Who is the finest among the three people: Reverend Saviṭṭha's answer - The person freed by faith
Reverend Mahākoṭṭhita's answer - The personal witness
Reverend Sāriputta's answer - The person attained to view
The difficulty in declaring one of the t: In some cases, a person who is freed by faith is practicing for perfection, while the personal witness and the one attained to view are once-returners or non-returners.
In some cases, a personal witness is practicing for perfection, while the one freed by faith and the one attained to view are once-returners or non-returners.
In some cases, one attained to view is practicing for perfection, while the one freed by faith and the personal witness are once-returners or non-returners.
In this matter, it’s not easy to definitively declare that one of these three people is finest.
